segments.text: I just can't get over the woman at the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's in her own little world, polishing that plate with such concentration.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can someone ignore a literal flood happening right at their feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her expression remains absolutely neutral, utterly unaffected.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It almost makes me angry, this level of detachment from reality.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is probably cold and squishy around her ankle by now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the faucet just keeps running, a constant reminder of the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's completely missing the children's adventure, and their danger, behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a strange kind of tunnel vision, focused only on that one small task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The entire kitchen is going awry, yet she's in a bubble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could understand what’s so important about that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s truly baffling to witness such a scene unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole situation just feels so incredibly frustrating.
segments.speaker: PAR
